description: The FHIR type of a property - used on the value property of a primitive type (for which there is no type in the FHIR typing system), and Element.id, Resource.id, and Extension.url. All of these have a non-FHIR type in thir structure definition, and this specifies the applicable FHIR type.

element.comment: This is in effect, compiler magic for the typing system.
element.definition: The FHIR type of a property - used on the value property of a primitive type (for which there is no type in the FHIR typing system), and Element.id, Resource.id, and Extension.url. All of these have a non-FHIR type in thir structure definition, and this specifies the applicable FHIR type.
element.short: Base FHIR type (when a special property)

binding.description: A version specific list of the data types defined by the FHIR specification for use as an element  type (any of the FHIR defined data types).

name: fhir-type
publisher: Health Level Seven, Inc. - [WG Name] WG

element.comment: This is in effect, compiler magic for the typing system.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: The FHIR type of a property - used on the value property of a primitive type (for which there is no type in the FHIR typing system), and Element.id, Resource.id, and Extension.url. All of these have a non-FHIR type in thir structure definition, and this specifies the applicable FHIR type.
element.short: Base FHIR type (when a special property)

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension

binding.description: A version specific list of the data types defined by the FHIR specification for use as an element  type (any of the FHIR defined data types).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](extensibility.html) for a list).
